perturbation.original_text: 1.1  "Ancillary Agreements" shall mean the following agreements between Inktomi and Microsoft, and all amended versions thereof or successor agreements thereto: (i) the Software Development Agreement of even date herewith; (ii) the Information Services Agreement of even date herewith; (iii) the Loan Agreement of even date herewith, and any and all "Promissory Notes" and/or "New Note" executed pursuant thereto; (iv) the Security Agreement of even date herewith; and (v) the Escrow Agreement of even date herewith.
perturbation.changed_text: 1.1  "Ancillary Agreements" shall mean the following agreements between Inktomi and Microsoft, and all amended versions thereof or successor agreements thereto: (i) the Software Development Agreement of even date herewith; (ii) the Information Services Agreement of even date herewith; (iii) the Loan Agreement of even date herewith; (iv) the Security Agreement of even date herewith.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the Escrow Agreement from the definition of 'Ancillary Agreements,' sections referencing 'all Ancillary Agreements' will now exclude it. However, if any clause later relies on the Escrow Agreement within the context of 'all Ancillary Agreements,' it creates a contradiction.

perturbation.original_text: 2.7  Inktomi will assign two (2) full-time Inktomi employees exclusively dedicated to maintenance duties hereunder. Such employees are identified in Exhibit D attached hereto; and their replacements shall be subject to Microsoft's prior written approval (which approval Microsoft will not unreasonably withhold). Notwithstanding the foregoing, if Microsoft and Inktomi mutually agree in writing, additional Inktomi employees may be required to be assigned to maintenance duties hereunder.
perturbation.changed_text: 2.7  Inktomi will assign employees to maintenance duties hereunder. If Microsoft and Inktomi mutually agree in writing, additional Inktomi employees may be required to be assigned to maintenance duties hereunder.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the clause specifying two full-time dedicated employees and removing the reference to Exhibit D, the contract becomes vague regarding the level of maintenance support. However, clauses referencing specific responsibilities previously associated with these dedicated employees now lack a clearly defined responsible party, causing internal inconsistency and impacting enforceability.

perturbation.original_text: 3.2  Microsoft acknowledges that, pursuant to Inktomi's contractual arrangement with its subcontractor, Exodus Communications, Inc. ("Exodus"), Inktomi will locate the Hosting Servers at the facilities of Exodus, and Exodus will provide power and Internet telecommunications services to the Hosting Servers. However, Microsoft will have no obligations or liabilities to Exodus, Inktomi will remain liable for providing all Services to Microsoft notwithstanding its arrangement with Exodus, and Inktomi will [*] and [*] against from any and all [*] to [*] (in accordance with the procedures specified in Section [*] below). A copy of the contract(s) between Inktomi and Exodus is/are attached hereto as Exhibit [*], and Inktomi shall not modify said contract(s) or replace Exodus as its subcontractor for the applicable services (including without limitation by having Inktomi perform the Services directly) without Microsoft's prior written approval (which approval Microsoft agrees to not unreasonably withhold). Inktomi shall provide Exodus with a copy of the Security Measures applicable under this Agreement and will use commercially reasonable efforts to ensure that Exodus strictly adheres to all such Security Measures.
perturbation.changed_text: 3.2  Microsoft acknowledges that Inktomi will locate the Hosting Servers at a facility providing power and Internet telecommunications services. Inktomi will remain liable for providing all Services to Microsoft. Inktomi shall provide a copy of the Security Measures applicable under this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the mention of Exodus and the reference to the contract with Exodus in Exhibit [*], while keeping the phrase 'Inktomi will remain liable for providing all Services,' the contract creates uncertainty. Any clauses referencing the obligations of the subcontractor, or limitations on Inktomi's ability to change subcontractors without approval, are now contradicted, as there is no explicitly stated subcontractor.
